Buryakov could not enter any of the Russian Federation's government offices in New York because of his covert status, according to the complaint, so he relied on Sporyshev and Podobnyy to relay intelligence to Moscow.
Buryakov passed information, which the group often referred to as a non-specific item like an "umbrella" or "hat," to Sporyshev during quick face-to-face meetings, the complaint said.
